intro: Valenzuelia trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined valenzuelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each leaflet having three distinct veins. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and stamens that are clustered around the pistil. Valenzuelia trinervis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
